snippet: Crossing a threshold in its battle with jihadist groups, Britain said it had killed two of its own citizens, suspected members of the Islamic State.
abstract: British Prime Min David Cameron issues statement to Parliament saying country's first armed drone strike in Syria killed three men, two of them British citizens, who were suspected Islamic State members; targeted drone strike is significant step for country and raises questions about scope of British activities in Middle East; lawmakers voted not to take part in military action in Syria two years earlier.

byline.contributor: Aurelien Breeden contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Crossing a threshold in its battle with jihadist groups, Britain said it had killed two of its own citizens, suspected members of the Islamic State.

headline.main: Britain Says It Killed 3 ISIS Suspects in First Drone Strike in Syria
headline.print_headline: Britain Says First Drone Strike in Syria Hit ISIS Suspects

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
